Home > Local History > Church Records > Madison Presbyterian Church M-Z

Madison Presbyterian Church

Last Names M - Z

Madison Presbyterian Church, also known as First Presbyterian Church was founded in 1815; the founding pastor was Rev. William Robinson. In 1819 the first church structure was located on the East side of West Street with a new street named Presbyterian Avenue hacked out to the front door. In 1840 the congregation relocated to the South side of Main between West and Mulberry until the fire in 1845. The church moved again in 1846 to Broadway Street between Vaughn (formerly First) and Second Streets.

MADISON PRESBYTERIANCHURCH RECORDS taken from microfilm (Roll Numbers 213, 214, 215, 216 & 217) on file at the Madison Jefferson County Public Library.
